page.title: 02Halvergate School
page.content: The present school is fifty years old, thirty one children from Halvergate, Tunstall and Wickhampton attend from age five to eleven when they transfer to Acle High School. The Headmaster teaches with one full and one part time teacher and ten hours per week from a welfare/clerical assistant. The school has two indoor toilets, electric storage heaters, a tarmac playground and a grass playing field. Few children go home to dinner, most bring packed lunches although cooked meals for thirteen are delivered from Freethorpe school. Occasionally the local schools combine sharing outings and entertainment. Numbers are declining and the school has joined the recently formed Norfolk Rural Schools Federation.
